Reviews.Title: “Affordable choice in the posh part of west Berlin which could do w/ a little more heart”
Reviews.Author: melbournetraveller20
Reviews.Content: I never enjoy being in a hotel that's doing construction but I guess it was just bad timing. I also don't particularly like stating in a hotel used by large tour groups- again just my bad luck. Aside from that the lobby reaked of meat pies! The rooms are like they are in the photos. Spacious bathrooms. Nice enough decor but the whole 'art' slant seems more staged than genuine. The front desk are brusque and short. Ask for directions and you invariably get scolded like a child or rapid-fire instructions which are hard to catch. Furthermore I got completely wrong information about the meeting point for my bike tour. Lucky I double checked myself.... The location is in a fairly fancy part of Berlin and for that reason it gives you an insight into how the other half live w/out the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: thjc
Reviews.Content: Our first room smelled of smoke, but the staff happily moved us to another room in the new wing. Clean, light and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and very cool”
Reviews.Author: tiger_bob85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights as part of a sight seeing trip of Berlin. The hotel cannot be faulted for cleanliness; the rooms are modern and not in any way dated. The only problem we had was with the air conditioning, which failed to work leading to a very hot room. However upon telling management we were quickly moved to another room. Great service. Bar is very nice also. Can't comment on breakfast as we didn't have it. Would recommend this. Ideally situated near Zoo underground station making for quick access to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: oljica
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel during ITB fair in Berlin! The location is excellent, just 2 minutes walk from famous kudamme! my room on the 6th floor was spacious and very clean, with comfortable bed mattresses and good sound isolation! Would definitaly come back, whether for business or leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Young, Fresh and Cool”
Reviews.Author: jaytourel
Reviews.Content: When we saw the Andy Warhol image on the hotel,we knew that we are for an experience lik no other. surprising as Warhol art and images this hotel is very artistic loyal to the Pop art theme which makes it very fresh and cool. If you love Warhol and his art, this is the place to be. We love the cool image that this reflects on the entire hotel. Its Popi, artistic, fresh and young with young staff, good looking energetic and attentive. You can think that you are more in Manhattan then in Germany which is a great plus. Not that I have anything against German hotels, but you can agree that Manhattan has invested the cool style hotel that all are trying to copy. The hotel has also a cool bar into the night and I have notices the hotel guests socializing and mingling, I guess its the right mood the design puts you in...however the breakfast was just right with big choices and all fresh and tasty. This hotel offers excellent value for money,and I certainly recommend it for business travelers and tourists,who would like to be in the center of Berlin west side and close to all its attractions.short walk from the famous Kudam street and it famous department store and shopping . The room was spacy,open windows, with large bathroom, huge shower for two , bath tab and all amenities of five star hotel. You feel that you are in a large museum showing Andy Warhol art without buying ticket and waiting in long ques. We love Warhol art and I am sure that if he was alive he would love to stay here as well. Its such a great concept, I dont know why you don't have more there hotel like this in other cities. Well done, excellent management ,so don't look more when in Berlin,its the place to be for pleasant stay without paying the high price of Berlin hotels. A friend has recommended it and I didnt need to spend much time on web search, We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: emzi1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Art'otel City West, Berlin for a city break weekend away as we love Berlin and try and stay in different areas when ever we go. This area, Charlottenburg, is my favourite so far! Think of it as Berlin's Knightsbridge/Chelsea. There are endless fantastic restuarnts and bars, boutique shops and every designer shop you can think of on the main road. We had the corner suite which was huge and clean with a super king size comfy bed. The cocktails in the bar were great and not overpriced and I found the breakfast fantastic like many european hotel breakfasts are with lots of choice and delicious warm, fresh breads. If you are looking for a well priced, friendly hotel in a brilliant part of town this is a good contender.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The room was spartan but extremely clean, bright, and quite. Couldn't ask for a friendlier staff. I didn't eat breakfast as I thought that 15 euro was too high...but there are plenty of restaurants; lounges, markets and coffee shops to eat at in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie-Lucy
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried that this hotel might be a bit too far away from the main tourist attractions but I was pleasantly surprised! Did most of my travelling from the S-Bahn station, Savignyplatz, which was a pleasant ten minute walk from the hotel, and then took about ten minutes to get to Hauptbahnhoff, one of the main central stations. In terms of the hotel, if you like Andy Warhol (which I do!) then you'll love this hotel! My room was fab - spacious, trendy and spotlessly clean. Really comfy bed and great bathroom with a lovely big shower! I had breakfast in the hotel once which didn't have the largest selection and seemed a little expensive at 15 euros. However, there are plenty of coffee shops in the area which is what I preferred to do in the morning. Didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as was so busy sight-seeing in Berlin, but my experience of it was excellent and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “It's a bit far from the tourist attractions but great value for money”
Reviews.Author: markbetsan
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a late deal and was pleasantly surprised by the value for money. Rooms are quite spacious and clean. The corridors are very long and it's easy to get lost especially with being distracted by the Andy Warhol art on the wall. We didn't eat breakfast here but there are a lot of nice restaurants and germans pubs a few streets away and there is a carrefour round the courner that opens quite late. All in all, good value for a small price.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarianLei
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Berlin for business reasons and stayed at the art'otel west for 2 nights. I was inspired by the reviews from previous guests plus attractive price for a double room, and decided to book a room. The personnel at the reception was kind from the start, although always very busy and a bit stressed. It is true that it's well located, if you don't mind walking10 minutes under the rain to get to the closest metro station. It is only 100 meters from one of the most well-known shopping streets in Berlin (K-damm) if you're interested in that. The rooms were very clean, and with all the comfort expected in a 3 stars hotel (and nothing more, nothing extra, nothing "luxurious"). The TV was very old (not flat screen) and had only German channels. The WI-FI connection was excellent, and I was on the 6th floor. .. All in all it was ok, except from one episode: the room was very cold at night. The first night I tried to check the AC and adjust it myself, but to my surprise I found no "switch". I called the reception and they explained very kindly that the whole heating system is centrally managed for all the floors (thus one cannot regulate the temperature as desired) and that I should understand that it is hard to please everyone's needs. "Some find it too hot others too cold" (Exact words). And thus what they usually do, when enough guests complain at the same time, is to switch it on and high for some time until the guests call back complaining because it's too warm. She promised they would do that again. Moral: I slept with a sweater, socks and double cover (and I swear I'm not someone that usually suffers from being cold!) Close to the hotel (like 10 minutes walking) it's Savignyplatz, a beautiful and charming area full of cozy restaurants, cafes and small designers shops. You should check it out, especially at night! And for breakfast I'd recommend you the cafe that it's right underneath the entrance to Savigny train station, next to a bookshop. Actually, you shouldn't pay for having breakfast at the hotel, as it's plenty of beautiful cozy bars all around where you'll have a lot nicer breakfast at a lot lower price. Also, if you're going to Berlin for a Fair at the Messe Berlin, this is the right place to stay since it is very close and easy to get both with public transportation and by taxi (only 8 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The room was well equipped and the staff were very knowledgeable (especially Santiago!) and very friendly. A great base for exploring Berlin. Would be happy to stay here again, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay and great value”
Reviews.Author: tripbiscuit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights and would happily stay again. I was upgraded to one of their larger rooms (possibly due to Club Carlson membership?) and thought it was fabulous. The room was beautifully (and quirkily) decorated, and was very well laid out with plenty of desk space, loads of electric sockets, a comfortable bed, good lighting, and a good bathroom (walk-in shower, nice amenities). The teas and hot chocolate in the room were good quality, and it was nice to have a robe even if I didn't use it. It was spotless and I slept very well with no external noise at all. Wifi was free. It's not fast but it's adequate for planning a leisure trip and keeping in touch with home. We didn't eat breakfast there (15 euros for american style buffet) but walked 10 minutes to Schwarzes Cafe. There are supermarkets very close by, and the location is good for public transport. I think the concept of the hotel is to appear laid-back and a bit hip, and the common areas are a bit designerly sparse, but the underlying service is as you would expect from the Radisson chain, and nothing seemed to be too much bother. Staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming, and it was nice to sit at the bar in the evening with our laptops and plan where we were going. There was a sauna which I didn't try. I would recommend it to friends and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “does not deserve 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: kivancgorkem
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in a short distance of Kurfürstendamm and public transportation. Staff was also helpfull during our stay. Rooms are kind of outdated and simply furnished. Beds are really unconfortable you can feel every spring in the bed, I could not get a good sleep during my stay. Another problem was with the AC it was not possible to manage it, but it dried whole air in the room, and I got problems with my nose. There is always a long time waiting in front of the elevator, which was really annoying. My opinion is this is not a 4 star hotel, the room quality was really poor. Does not deserve star rating and its price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: inothernews
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Warhol-themed art'otel in Berlin. Located near the high-end shopping district on Kurfurstendamm and not far from the SavignyPlatz S-Bahn stop, this was a comfortable place to rest...especially as other aspects of our trip went wrong. My friend ended up not feeling well and spent most of her time in the hotel room. The staff was overloaded as something had happened to the cook and they had to pitch in, but they still brought her great room service. I especially enjoyed the scene at the hotel bar in the evening. Thomas, from South Africa, was an excellent conversationalist, and a great mixologist! We made some nice friends while there--we ended up deciding, after second dinner plans, to just meet back up at the hotel bar, as they were great drinks and a nice scene. Love the Warhol everywhere! We did not eat any meals, such as breakfast or dinner, at the on-site restaurant. I did feel the dining room/lounge felt a little stark and cold and empty at times, though it was comfortable for afternoon coffee when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to rest beetween sights”
Reviews.Author: magsandwags
Reviews.Content: Got a Groupon deal and stayed here 2 nights in July. Lovely, clean, massive room (think we might have upgraded to a suite?). It was a bit out of the way but we were travelling with a baby so it was good to be removed from the manic centre. 5 min walk to nearest tube, 10 to get the train directly to town. A few decent places to eat locally, but avoid the hotel restaurant- total waste of money. Breakfast good enough, but we got a free meal as part of our Groupon deal and it was atrocious. Good toiletries. Comfy bed. Nice & quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, I could breathe at night”
Reviews.Author: sugarflick
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, did not eat here as too much to see in Berlin, were up & out. Visit was to see Rammstein at O2 world, & as much as Berlin as possible. Not far from the U-Bahn, great transport system, buy a Berlin Welcome Card, staff gave excellent advice on travel. Our room was fab, huge and airy, so clean too, not stuffy so could breath, slept like a log! Thankyou Art 'otel, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Looking fwd to staying at your hotel”
Reviews.Author: mysoupdragon
Reviews.Content: We have chosen to stay here because the hotel manager has personally acknowledged each review, good or bad we will make our own mind up but it looks perfect, so 3 nights in Berlin & a Rammstein gig, well! We could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Bugger the begrudgers.”
Reviews.Author: Digeridoodingo
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the negative reviews and I think they must be talking about a different hotel. The location is excellent, a little far from the cultural bits but easily reach by Berlin's excellent public transit system. The staff are super helpful and my room was beautiful. I will definitely stay here again. So, as we say in Ireland, bugger the begrudgers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good/great location”
Reviews.Author: deekay99
Reviews.Content: Generally very good. Only a couple of minutes from 249 bus stop and 5 minutes from U Bahn. Room comfortable though lighting could have been better. Also, shower tended to spray water over bathroom floor. Free wifi a plus Didn't eat there but plenty of local places in Uhlandstrasse and Ku'damm for breakfast & dinner

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: TWS954
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here, superbly placed in central Berlin & a short walk to the U-bahn. I found the hotel clean, fresh, comfortable, excellent staff & wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, if I return! A definate recommendation to anyone, (who isn't over fussy)! There was some noise regards construction work but it hardly bothered me. The free Internet is troublesome, I got it to work one night but hardly a major hassle to me. I didn't go for breakfast by choice but had a lovely coffee, most mornings! Overall great value for what I paid & compared to London, almost luxury!!! Berlin was a delight, the history was the reason for my visit & I wasn't dis-appointed. Beware of work on the U-bahn, it threw me until I sussed out the changes I had to make. Just loved every minute of my stay, thanks!!! Tim W Siret - Oxford UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but be careful of the loud construction next door”
Reviews.Author: WorldX1
Reviews.Content: Everything is nice about the hotel: comfortable room, good location, nice staff. You can't go wrong staying there. One thing that everyone needs to be aware of is that there is construction going on next door that can start as early as 07:59 and sounds like someone is banging on your wall nonstop until you leave the room. How do I know it was 07:59? That's what I saw on the clock when it woke me up. However, this is probably only an issue for part of the building. So if you're reading this, then you are looking into staying at the hotel, so what I'd suggest is to call up the hotel and tell them you're sensitive to noise and to make a reservation away from the construction. I'm sure it will be quiet and comfortable. Also note that WiFi is _not_ complimentary, like it says on the website. It's 9 Euros a day. That's fine, but I didn't expect it, and one reason I booked the hotel was because it said the word "complimentary"

Reviews.Title: “Destinctly average”
Reviews.Author: Helena-Mae
Reviews.Content: A little out of the city centre, despite claiming to be conveniently located. Ok so if all your idea of a holiday is to shop, then maybe it is, but it's a long way from Berlin's cultural city centre. The deal included an evening meal, and room for 2 nights. Whilst the decor was very Warhol and different (though not entirely sure it worked), and the room clean and spacious, the evening meal food was poor, and the bar-man's cocktail skills abysmal. Don't order a Caipirinha if you don't wish to be disappointed. The food was certainly cooked up for under a fiver in a microwave! Breakfast thankfully was better, with more variety. Lots of building noise within/around the hotel during the day. Not too intrusive, but not great for a holiday. The staff...maybe it's just a diifferent culture, or maybe it's being in a major city, but their customer service skills had a huge void. I won't be returning- will chance my luck somewhere else the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: CanWith
Reviews.Content: To start with the good bits; location and cleanliness, friendly yet not very professional staff. The blah bit: The hotel does by no means deserve any label containing "art". The overall impression was sleek Ikea, and it is quite ridiculous with a chunky TV in the room. The bad bits: - Reservation got messed up, got a room of a lower grade than what was reserved. Wouldn't surprise me if they had charged me the extra. Got rectified, yet new room had less towels and no bathrob. - Extremely loud construction noise from 07:25-09:00 on Saturday morning. Could neither sleep nor work. So much for a rest. - Shower wall so short that the entire bathroom floor incl. toilet got soaking wet and dangerously slippery. Had to wipe off with the towels that were there, leaving no clean towel for later. I would have gone for "poor" in my rating but today's email made me change it to terrible. Despite I said I wouldn't like to sign up for Club Carlson news, both online and when asked by reception staff, I keep getting info. When unsubscribing I am informed that they can still contact me with requests to update my online info etc. I clicked on the link to change my privacy settings but have to set up an account to do so. Appalling!

Reviews.Title: “Groupon voucher scheme.”
Reviews.Author: JEFFOFBELFAST2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of August after booking it through the Groupon voucher scheme. After reading many negative reviews on Trip Advisor before hand we emailed the manager about a room away from the building noise. She was very helpfull and we were given what we asked for the room was large,clean,quiet and had an excellent bathroom. Not a large hotel but well placed for good bars,restaraunts,tube stations and shops. The buffett style breakfast was very good the dinning are for this was quiet and well layed out. The free packed lunch was fine and very usefull as we had a lot to do in a limited time so not much time to stop for lunch. The free evening meal was much as described by other reviewers,but my partner and I have a good sense of humour and had a laugh about it.Otherwise the hotel was very good and had helpfull and polite staff and a room to keep your suitcases in. We had a wonderful time in Berlin and we enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Not large,not fancy but fullfilled our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable City Break”
Reviews.Author: caldey
Reviews.Content: Six of us booked this hotel through the Groupon Voucher scheme, and were very pleased with the quality of the Hotel, The Staff I must say, are all very helpful and Polite, and nothing is too much trouble. The Rooms are modern and clean (ikea style) The Breakfast which was included was buffet style, plenty of choice of Cereals, breads, meats, eggs etc. The hotel is in a good location for sightseeing. I would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel for Berlin sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: RosieCadiff
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at the quality and value of this hotel as my son and I had booked it as part of a Groupon offer, for what we paid. Very attentive staff and food ok. We enjoyed breakfast in our room on the two mornings we were there for no extra charge. The evening meal was a set one [as per Groupon deal] and although on the cool side, was certainly edible. Otherwise we ate out and pleased that as tourists we were not 'ripped off'. The room was comfortable with twin beds. Our room was overlooking the side street so were not disturbed too much with the construction work going on at the front of the hotel. They did put up a notice to warn us about this. Amenities were accessible and all in all a good couple of days were had.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: tromanCardiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with a groupon offer. The hotel is very good and has all the features you need in a hotel. The rooms are very novel, with basic necessities. My first impression of the room was, if Ikea did hotels, this is probably what it would look like. The staff were very helpful and nothing was ever a problem. It's relatively small and has a nice personal feel to it. The hotel is perfectly situated to Kurfürstendamm, one of the main streets in Berlin. It's only about a 10 minute walk to here, and also there are two metro stations, Uhlandstraße and Kurfürstendamm, which are useful to get around the city. It's also really easy to travel for free on the metro, so make good use of this. The hotel is very clean and overall, this stay was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Scottish_Sisters
Reviews.Content: Easy access to West Berlin, Shopping, Open Top Bus Tour starting point and also Underground stations to go to East Berlin and airport. Staff were very friendly, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm, not so sure”
Reviews.Author: eridia
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nicely appointed: loved the decor and the art, but it was sooooo hot and airless. The aircon seemed to have no effect and we had to have the windows open 24 hours, which made it very noisy as the hotel is on a main road and our room was on the front. Part of our package was a free evening meal which was utterly appalling and a free packed lunch (sandwiches fruit and a kitkat) was very nice. The hotel is quite out of the way, but one evening we went out to find a bar and discovered on the back streets ( come out of the hotel turn right and right again, keep walking) bars and restaurants aplenty - and very nice too. Take your own hair dryer - there is one in the bathroom but its hard to use and there is no ventilation ( not good on many levels!) so you can get a bit hot in there with thedryer going.Overall, I wouldn't choose to stay here again - not that it is awful ( well the food is!) but it was too far out and too bloody hot!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: SianLondon_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed as part of the Groupon deal and were a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews. We had upgraded to the larger room when buying the deal, and I emailed the manager Katya (an absolute credit to the hotel) to say I had heard about the construction noise and would it be possible to be placed at the other end of the hotel. She very kindly reassured us about hours of construction work and said she would ensure we were put away from the work. What we didn't expect was to be upgraded to a Suite which was such a lovely surprise and testament to the fact that staff at this hotel genuinely care about your stay. We didn't hear any noise whilst we were there. The room was stunning and so spacey,great bathroom. Tricky locks but the receptionist explained how to use it very clearly and was very friendly. Breakfast was brilliant - a real spread. Lunch was a good free gift. Dinner wasn't amazing, but it was free and perfectly edible. The complimentary wine was brilliant. Couldn't have asked for more. Don't let negative reviews put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would recommend to others!!”
Reviews.Author: cvfloho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art'otel as part of the Groupon deal and had a lovely time! We emailed Katja Hagenbucher (Hotel Manager) before our holiday and she was really helpful with tips on how to get to the hotel and allocated us a fantastic room - thank you! Our room was large, clean and comfortable. It was also very quiet. The breakfasts each day were great and there was a large selection of food both hot and continental style food. The hotel is located conveniently for public transport and cycle paths. Top tip - don't bother with public transport rent a bike! Much more fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lorelie21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were not sure what would await us having read previous reviews about the Groupon deal, but were pleasantly surprised by this hotel Check in was swift, all the reception staff spoke perfect english, we were early but were able to leave our bags in their locked store room for free. The room was large with a good sized bathroom, the only small problem was that the shower door didn't seal completely so the floor got wet once but nothing major. We heard no building work the whole time, we were there on a weekend so maybe that was why. Breakfast was delicious, lots of bread, cold meats, smoked salmon, cheese, yogurts, cereal, hot breakfast etc to choose from. One time the rolls and croissants ran out just before I got to them but only had to wait 5 mins before they were replenished, and it was close to breakfast finishing time. We were able to drink the free bottle of wine at dinner. The food was certainly not the best meal I've ever had (see my review of a fantastic meal at s'Braetle 5 mins away) and the chicken was very salty but overall was quite nice. The packed lunch was more than adequate, I wasn't expecting caviar but another woman who picked hers up at the same time was complaining about the fact that the sandwich was white bread and she didn't eat white bread, she wouldn't have bought it in a shop etc etc. What people fail to remember is that was free! For the deal you got, a cheap weekend away in a beautiful city with a few extras thrown in for free, I really can't see what people are complaining about.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: charleylousy
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here before our trip, we were somewhat nervous about how our stay would pan out. We stayed on the Groupon deal and had the greatest time. We could not fault the hotel at all and are perplexed as to how our visit could have been so different from others'....maybe we just don't like to pick holes!! I emailed Katja (the manager) before leaving and she was most helpful and upgraded us to a corner suite. The room was huge with a massive bed and was equipped with everything you would expect to find in a hotel room. It was spotlessly clean and the towels and linen were too. We were not disturbed at all by any building works throughout our stay and only heard it after 8am (by which time we were awake as wanted to be out and about, not spend the day in the hotel!). We received a bottle of red wine as part of the deal and were able to swap this for white without any problems and were able to choose the wine we would like. We drank this with our evening meal in the hotel, which was also part of the deal. It was a set three course menu, and while it wouldn't have won any awards, it was edible and was welcome at the end of a long day. The waitress was lovely and couldn't have been more friendly. We also received a packed lunch the following day and again we were grateful for this; it was nothing fancy but exactly what you'd expect from a packed lunch! Fine by us! Breakfast was really good too. There was plenty of choice, from fruit, cereal and yogurt to bread, meat and cheese and smoked salmon. The hotel was well situated, close to U-bahn stations and therefore a good base for exploring the city. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and I feel they did all they could to make our trip a pleasant one. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central position”
Reviews.Author: Solihull
Reviews.Content: Just back from two nights at this somewhat quirky, but very modern, clean and efficient hotel. Rooms are apacious and the staff young, enthusiastic with a good command of English. Easy walking transfer from the zoo garden station (10 mins) - non stop from Schonfeld station (25mins)and 3 ueros for the ticket. Taxi is 37 euros. food and drink was slightly overprices Beer 4.40 breakfast 15 euros continental, but the room it self was inexpensive at £23 pppn. Great for tour buses, Kurfeestdamm? Strasse and walking distance to Brandengerg, Reichstag (30 mins). Take a map though, street signs in Berlin are not very clear. To summarise - great little hotel in a very elegant city - you can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: m62ed
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and were very impressed by the hotel - in particular the staff and the level of service. Unlike many we were not too bothered by the building works ie did not hear much at all, but we were up and out relatively early in a bid to enjoy Berlin for the short time we were there. We would contemplate returining to this hotel or another hotel in the chain - the breakffast was fine but the meal provided on the Groupon deal was poor.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE TILL THE BUILDING WORK IS COMPLETE!”
Reviews.Author: Cherryred74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Groupon deal and it was therefore reasonably priced at £210 for two nights including bed and breakfast, and three course meal and a packed lunch. Firstly, we paid extra for a large room, which upon arrival was two beds pushed together, not a double. We asked for a double and were given a key to a room the size of a shoe box that stank of smoke. Hence, we went with the large twin bed room. The room was nice and big and furnished with average furniture (nothing like the one on the groupon picture). No double duvet; two single, pillows were old and lumpy, towels were grey and threadbare. The bathroom was clean with a bath and shower which was very powerful, but the shower screen was tiny, and as a result the floor became waterlogged after every shower, which made it very dangerous. First night we had our three course meal. Starter was rocket, paramasan and balsamic salad. This was rocket leaves, with a spoonful of grated parmesan and was drenched in balsamic which made it virtually inedible. Main was pasta with a chicken breast with a slab of mozzarella grilled on top of it. The pasta was so over cooked it was waterlogged and just disintegrated in your mouth. Pudding was berry compote with custard (packet) on top this was ok. Basically on the whole it was revolting. If you read other reviews, many people say this. The hotel responds by saying the issue has been sorted. IT HAS NOT. The food is dreadful, and they are still serving the same rubbish they have been serving for ages. So, off to bed, only to be woken at 7,30am by drilling and hammering (please follow links for some footage, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uxw6fsw-5QQ http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zencFZjkPc) It was unbearably loud. We asked at reception what was going on and were given some excuse about the building next door, and how it might be part of the hotel but they weren’t sure so it wasn’t really their fault. Now, for building work that wasn’t part of the hotel, the builders used the lift, the hotel lobby, the floor we were staying on and one even went behind the reception desk – hummmm. I think we may have been fobbed off. So, then to breakfast. Tried the sausages and what I thought were hash browns (they were actually mini burgers) and the scrambled egg; all pretty horrible. Next day opted for fruit and yoghurt and a croissant; this was fine, but in fairness it would be harder to get this wrong! There was also the usual cereal, bread, ham, cheese, smoked salmon etc. Next morning, woken again but drilling, but this time they managed to hold off till 8am. We then hired bikes and had them charged to our room. We packed, came to reception and stored our bags, my partner paid up the hotel bill and off we went on the bikes. We returned at 3pm and sat in reception, in full view of both receptionists until 4pm when my partner went to get some cash for the taxi. We then walked across the road to the taxi rank, with just enough cash for the fare and a bite to eat at the airport. We were then stopped by a panting receptionist who had chased us across the road, asking for 20 euros for the bikes, 20 euros that should have been charged to our rooms. We paid, which then left us short of the taxi so we had to stop enroute to get out more money, at an additional cost, to cover the fare. This hotel could be good, but it wasn’t. Staff were very nice and helpful even though they fobbed us off about the noise. Food was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: Carole17
Reviews.Content: Seems like everyone staying was on the Groupon deal! room was clean, staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful (special mention for Laura). Beds very comfortable and baths full size with powerful hot showers (sometimes an issue in Europe!). the included evening meal was awful but breakfast was excellent. complimentary bottle of wine was a nice touch but we didn't have time to drink ours so handed it over to an arriving grouponer. (hope you enjoyed it, mate!) The construction didn't bother us (why go to Berlin if you're gong to spend the day in a hotel room?!) Location was great- minutes from Uhlandstrasse U Bahn (U1) and 2 mins walk fro Kudamm.

Reviews.Title: “Average, wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: hague22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Friday & Saturday night with a Groupon deal. The room was fairly small but clean and functional for a short break. Bed very comfortable, we were at the front of the hotel and the traffic noise disturbed me a little. Air conditioning didn't seem to work but wasn't a problem as the weather was shocking. The reception staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful giving good sound advice. Breakfast is self service buffet style with plenty of choice, the evening meal however was appalling I don't think I have ever eaten such a bland meal as part of the Groupon deal we also had a packed lunch which look so unappetising we left it there! There is building work going on next door but they must have downed tools for the weekend as we didn't hear a thing. Lack of comfy communal areas. Bar in hotel was always unattended and it was often difficult to get service. Good location for a weekend break but wouldn't chose it again.

Reviews.Title: “fine for some days”
Reviews.Author: jacobo88
Reviews.Content: pros: close to the city center, rooms clean and bathroom clean. the bed was ok. Front desk girls were nice, they offered me this point card for frequent customers :). breakfast cheap and good. cons: very small rooms, the air condition was not working when i was there. parking the car and be very tricky since you get into an elevator that takes to down and then you have to maneuver in a very stretch space. Going out was worse do the same thing but backwards oooohh my good, no no , i turned the car around(toyota avensis) took me like 15 minutes , going into the elevator other 15 minutes, came out sweating and finally the light............

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and very friendly great location.”
Reviews.Author: CrosswaysManor
Reviews.Content: Having chosen to go to Berling on a Groupon offer, we did not have high expectations of the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was in a great locations, the staff very friendly and helpful and the room very clean. A perfect base for a city break. Breakfast offered a wide selection of cereals , fruit etc. An evening meal was included in the offer and this was onlt average, but we chose to have ours just before we left for the airport...it was a huge improvement on Easyjet sandwiches. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be inthe heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: kerrymcg
Reviews.Content: We also stayed with the Groupon voucher and I guess they're trying to fill rooms which are unsaleable with the construction. It would have been nice to know about the buliding noise but it didn't really affect us as we were out all day, started a bit early at 7am but at least it got us out of bed! Room was a good size, nice clean bathroom, nice toileteries and blackout curtains. Didn't turn the TV on! Very good location for exploring the city and plenty of bars/restaurants nearby to choose from. Set meal for dinner was disappointing but breakfast was excellent and the free bottle of wine was absolutely delicious! If a hotel should be judged by it's staff, this one deserves to do very well. The staff were fantastic, friendly and helpful. Despite the noise it was a pleasure to stay and we will be back to see the new extension too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWilkin
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The service was fantastic and the rooms were presented excellently. The beds were extremely comfortable (I usually dread European city centre hotels as the beds are usually hard) and made for a great sleep after a tiring day of sightseeing. We upgraded to an XL room and it was HUGE! The breakfast buffet was well stocked and although I'm not really a breakfast person, I felt myself going back for more. We had the Groupon voucher which entitled us to a 3 course meal, which was ok if slightly not to my taste and the free lunch came in handy. Overall a great hotel in a great city, I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with huge beds and friendl people”
Reviews.Author: JoLeicester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a Groupon Deal and was pleasantly surprised. At first we thought it might be a bit too far from the main sites but having seen most of them whilst we were there we thought this was in a great location. You can wander the nearby streets with ease and quickly get across town when needed. The famous shopping street wasone street away and it was a 10 minute walk to the main station at Zoo Gardens.The staff were lovely, let us check in early after a 6am flight and gave us all the info we needed re trains etc. The breakfast has lots of choice and served till 11 at weekends which was a bonus. We had a quality meal in the restaurant and a substantial packed lunch when we went out for the day. The room was lovely, a corner suite with a huge bed which was hard to get out of! It was spotlessly clean and had everything you needed including toiletries, a well stocked mini bar and safe. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Berlin and we will hopefully be back ourselves in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “very very nice hospitality we loved it we felt like we were at home”
Reviews.Author: nino1963
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely time, starting from the very first day to last, everything was excellent service and staff was immaculate, breakfast was very nice, a lots of good choice. lunch pack was a lovely idea, but dinner was a little disappointed, thank you to welcome us with a nice bottle of wine. great cosy room good size bed nice in everything.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with hotel & would recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: CallySydney
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but adequate & the staff couldn't have been more helpful & attentive. We stayed 5 nights & had other family members there for some of the visit. Everything worked well. Restaurant good & well priced. Wifi reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Val_and_David
Reviews.Content: We took up a Groupon offer to stay here and added on an extra night. The Groupon deal was very good value and all the elements of the deal were provided efficiently. They even invited us to drink our inclusive bottle of wine in the restaurant at dinner, which was a nice touch and meant we were not treated as captives to buy another bottle of wine if we had not drunk our feebie. The reception staff were VERY helpful and answered every query we made, large or small! We were made to feel very welcome. We had no idea where the hotel was located when we booked, but we thought it was just about the best location in Berlin for a couple in our age group (50-60) - the area around Savignyplatz is very romantic with lovely restaurants and cafes and the leafy shopping area of Kurfurstendamm is steps away, as is Tiergarten for relaxing bike rides into the East CIty. Bikes for hire were an added bonus (Oh, and so was the kettle etc in the room!). Apart from the ealy morning hammering (not the hotel's fault) our other negative observations were 1. the bath towels! Very skimpy and badly laundered and not enough of them! Perhaps the hotel is waiting to replace them during the re-furbishment later this year? 2. Very old TV's and not enough English Channels (the hotel plans to upgrade?). 3. The restaurant lacks atmosphere and the excellent bar is under-used for the same reason I suspect. Perhaps the planned re-furb will change that, in the meantime a few candles here and there in the evening would transform the place! Don't let these niggles put you off staying though. We will more than likely go back to see the refurbishment complete as we loved Berlin and the Berliners!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: laniepops
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May.From arriving at the reception to leaving all the staff could not have been more help full,the rooms were very clean and comfortable,the buffet breakfast had lots of choice and was constantly been replenished by the staff I would stay at this hotel again and recommend to others thank you

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: ellijayjeff
Reviews.Content: art'otel is a very good location and service was nice. The reception was very good to help us with questions about tours and everything Berlin.Hotel is very modern and dont pay attention to all the photos of Andy Worhal unless you are a fan.........Berlin is a fantastic city and we made a very good choice by staying at the art'hotel according to trip tripadvisors reviews....Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable value with a modern arty touch”
Reviews.Author: jerrys40
Reviews.Content: I was planning a long weekend in Berlin and was intrigued by the description of this hotel in an online offer that came from groupon. Some research quickly showed that the groupon deal was no bargain and it was just as good to book through expedia and a weekend developed into a 4 night stay, and the hotel did just what it says on the can - its comfortable, friendly and obliging staff, lots of warhol prints and in a great neighbourhood - off the K'damm far enough to be quiet but and easy walk into the buzz. For leisure it was ideal - I think for business the room would have been a bit small but they did have bigger ones I think

Reviews.Title: “A/C is a lie!”
Reviews.Author: travellady84
Reviews.Content: Lovely looking hotel, very clean, modern decor, good location (if you don't mind walking/public transit), but this hotel doesn't really have A/C. We stayed there last year when the weather was in the 80s and it was unbearable in the hotel. The windows barely opened (so no airflow), and it was actually perhaps 10 degrees warmer in the hotel than outside. The reception did nothing to help with the heat (we asked for a fan - and were denied!). Apparently they do have "A/C" because they pump water through the walls to cool it down but I'm certain that this wasn't even working (although they denied this at first - and only later another receptionist admitted this was the case). Needless to say I was very unhappy with the hotel. If its winter - stay here. If its summer/spring - don't put yourself through their lies and unpleasantry. There is a nicer hotel (but not significantly more expensive) literally 20 feet down the street. I'd highly recommend staying at the Abba Hotel (strong A/C, great service, expensive but totally worth it morning buffets and very pretty/romantic/modern rooms)!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: janed78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Group On Voucher and had a great time. All the staff we met were friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The room was spacious and clean and although it was a set menu there was a vegetarian option. The voucher was handled smoothly and any additional drinks could be added to your room or paid for as they were used depending on what you requested. I would recommend both the Group On deal and the hotel to anyone wanting to visit Berlin. Its close to lots of restaurants of all styles and prices and to the underground for easy travel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulandKateUK
Reviews.Content: Booked a two night stay through Groupon for my wife's birthday and had a wonderful time in Berlin and this hotel. The staff were fantastic, prompt replies to emails before we left, fruit and a card left in the room for my wife's birthday, help with the wi-fi and advice on where and what to do. We had an 'xl' room which was a good size with a big shower room with a wonderful Warhol Monroe on the wall looking over us. The food was good, three courses with a veggie option for dinner, a vast choice from the buffet for breakfast and even a packed lunch for our day out! The 'U1' underground station is a 5 minute walk away, which links all of Berlin's transport systems so easy to get around. We found the best way to see the city was a Segway City tour, 4 hours, all the sights with a guide and brilliant fun. Berlin is a great city and would highly recommend this hotel as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MaximusOliver
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, for a four night stay in Berlin. I would say it is an average hotel, but a great buy for the money. They rent bikes right from the hotel. The rooms are clean, with a modern decor. The staff is very helpful. In flipping through the TV channels, only two were in english. Although somehow the "Adult entertainment" channels are in the main TV lineup so families be aware!!! So yes this hotel give you free porn!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid using through Groupon or any kind of offer. It's not worth the hassle!”
Reviews.Author: MissDelBoy
Reviews.Content: Booked a deal via Groupon whereby I paid £210 for what was supposed to be a stay worth £425 supposedly. The stay was to include breakfast. 3 course dinner on one evening, a bottle of wine and a packed lunch on one day. The hotel itself was cool, in a great location and the staff on arrival were very friendly. We were told when checking in that the meal was from a set menu. We arrived to dinner and again the service was faultless but I can honestly say it was some of the worst food we had ever tasted. So bad that we just had to laugh about it. Breakfast was fine and served in our room (which was meant to be included in the deal but which we saw they'd tried to charge us for on check out and was quite a palava to get it taken off). All in all (despite a pleasant stay and loving the city) there was absolutely no way that our stay was worth £425!!! We had been uttterly duped there. The main issue has been since returning having found that the hotel have made another pending transaction of £255 to my account (despite my having paid for the hotel upfront via Groupon). It has now been two weeks and despite the twoing and froing with the hotel (who initially blamed it on my bank) I still haven't had the money returned to my account. I have been going back and forth with the hotel owner Katja and found her totally unwilling to accept any blame for this and has even gone as far to claim that many hotels around the world take such 'ghost transactions' from your account to secure the booking. This is total nonsense and I have never heard of any hotel taking money provisionally for a room that has already been paid for. The saga continues!!! Based on the latter, I will never stay at this hotel or any of it's chain again. Totally avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish experience”
Reviews.Author: reyn_nanc
Reviews.Content: Great service coupled with a fresh-feeling interior made for a very enjoyable stay. Location near Uhland str station made traveling around city a breeze (just be careful of construction on U1 line). Rooms are impeccably clean and shower was a delight. The front desk staff was always very helpful and friendly, and spoke English fluently. Nothing negative to say about our experience, would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LynneJSM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, 5-minutes from Ku'Damm and the Uhlandstr. U-Bahn station and about 10 minutes to the Savignyplatz S-Bahn station. You can get all over Berlin very quickly and easily. The hotel itself is new and exceptionally clean. My room was small -- perfect for one person, but it would have been tight for two people. There is construction going on next to the hotel, so when you book, I'd suggest requesting a room on the other side of the building. My room was on the 5th floor and it took quite a long time for the hot water to reach upstairs. Plan ahead and turn on the shower a few minutes before you plan to use it! Once I sorted out the hot water situation, the shower was great. As noted by the previous reviewer, you cannot adjust the temperature in the room -- that is unfortunate. Overall a very good stay -- would recommend it and stay there again. I got it for a great price on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise! Booked this for less than €100 so didn't expect to be so happy! Great neighbourhood - obviously a nice area with great shops, boutiques, restaurants and bars. Amazingly friendly staff with a great grasp of English and a willingness to help me with my patchy German! They even ordered us a pizza in when we rolled 'home' in the early hours after one too many cocktails! Oops! If you're in Berlin, try this hotel out - you wont be disappointed :-)

Reviews.Title: “great location near U ban, supermarket, clean, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: doribd
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling for business or seeks for a good place, not to far from the U ban and bus station. This hotel is located in a good place. 5 minutes from U ban, 5 minutes from supermarket and restaurants. I had a great staying, very helpful staff, clean place. The only thing that i didn't really care and that they need to improve is their breakfast and the internet wireless cost.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel, with helpful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Flightsocks
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern room and a good size for a single (with 2 beds). Great size bathroom with fab walk-in shower (high enough for tall people!) and nice toiletries. The staff were very helpful and polite and always said hello when you went past reception. The location was good and had a local feel around Savignyplatz area. Great coffee and cake in the nearby Berliner Kaffeerösterei. Also near the luxurious Kurfurstendamm for those with a hefty shopping budget. We were exploring most days so hopped on the U/S bahn nearby to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: itay_wulkan
Reviews.Content: It was a great joy to stay in Art`otel City Center West. From arrival till leaving the hotel the staff was always helpful and polite. Location is really good, near a supermarket, coffee places, Kudamm str. and the U-bahn station. This hotel is all about quality, this is the feeling you get when staying there. The design is superb. It`s a quiet, so is the street, in which you feel safe during the whole day. Booking in advance allowed us to achieve a really good price for what we received. In conclusion, this hotel is highly recommended. When we`ll visit Berlin again we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nellas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night trip to Berlin, staying at te Artótel. We loved the hotel and were surprised by the decoration of the room. The interior was very nicely done, the room was very clean and we had enough space. Breakfast is nicely stocked, good for a nice start of a busy day. The neighbourhood was nice, although not in the middle of the action. There are enough restaurants in the area, public transport is a 5-minute walk away. We would stay in this hotel again, it has everything that you need for a cityhotel. The hotelbar was empty every night, but there's more than enough places around to get your beer.

Reviews.Title: “Not Customer Oriented”
Reviews.Author: meg20London
Reviews.Content: I never actually managed to stay in this hotel given their draconian cancellation policy. Although I hear their rooms are quite small by someone else who stayed there. My partner had an unforeseen and necessary business meeting called so we had no choice but to consider moving the dates. We had pre-paid through Expedia but it wasn't up to Expedia to see if we could move the dates - it was up to the hotel (Expedia indicated that many hotels are willing to move dates as long as their costs are covered). After several calls 7 days and then 4 days before the reservation and indicating that I would pay any additional charge due to a possible rate change for the new dates requested - they simply decide to take my money for no service because they could. This isn't reasonable trade or people - I think it represents a bad attitude to customers which I assume will be reflected in the type of service it provides. Granted many will consider this review just sour grapes based on bad luck, but I think many others will agree this is the type of establishment to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: smast
Reviews.Content: Good Location, Room a little tired, Air Con not working and no bath only a shower i the room, a bit dissapointed,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but great value”
Reviews.Author: mikepowie
Reviews.Content: This is really an excellent hotel, especially when one considers the rates, which were superb. We stayed here last summer (on two occasions) when we were in Berlin for the leisure end of a business trip. I stayed at another hotel the previous Fall--about 1 km away. When I asked a Berlin friend for a recommendation, he suggested the art 'otels, where his parents stay when they're in town. Not only was the Art’otel at least as nice as the other property, it was about 30 euros/night cheaper. By American standards, the rooms are a tad small (though certainly large enough), but very clean and comfortable and the housekeeping did an excellent job. Both rooms had all the things we needed--an iron, refrigerator, hairdryer, and plenty of toiletries. During happy hours, we enjoyed sitting at the bar, checking our email and having an inexpensive Beck’s. All staff members at the front were professional, friendly and helpful. They humored my mediocre German, but when I needed it, they switched to English. One drawback, which is more a qualifier than an actual drawback, is the location. Lietzenburger Strasse can be a bit noisy and street is not particularly interesting. That said, it’s close to both the S-Bahn, the U-Bahn, grocery stores, Deutsche Post. Just don’t expect to walk out on the street and be in the center of Berlin action. The other minor thing is the A/C didn’t work great on one warm Berlin afternoon, but was usually fine. We were so happy, we’re not really considering other places (other than the sister art’otel properties) when we’re in Berlin again this summer, even if the rates are slightly higher.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaylorsHampshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, bright, clean, well run, with helpful and courteous staff. The rooms are good, beds very comfortable, well airconditioned. The price and breakfast are good. I fully recommend this hotel. The only qualification is that for us the interesting part of Berlin is on the other side of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel....Staff very professional and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: rossco026
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to Berlin staying in the Art Otel ... excellent service and attention to detail. In fact when I was there I was celebrating my birthday and came back from a day's sightseeing to find a personally written card and a fruit basket in the room. Rooms very clean and well maintained. When we were there the housekeeping staff came in to clean the bottles and inside of the mini bar... something that lacks in many hotels..... overall had a great location and stay, with a few nice restaurants around the corner and a great patisserie on the next street. When we return to Berlin (which we plan to do) we will stay here again for sure..... Thanks Again to the staff....

Reviews.Title: “Buget with Style”
Reviews.Author: vkamish
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by this hotel - not by any single feature - but by the overall package. It offers a surprisingly low rate for a hotel in a great location that is clean, bright and airy - and carried off in style. I wish that boutique budget hotels could be more like this one. I took some snaps on Nomadz, if you want to see more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, spotless rooms and tasty breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RMFM
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short break to Berlin with husband and two 18 year olds. This hotel is ideally situated just off the main shopping street in West Berlin. The bus journey from Tegel airport is around 20 minutes, with the nearest stop being about 3 minutes walk from the hotel. The fare is only 2.20 euros per person and buses run every 10 minutes. The overground and underground station, plus the bus depot, at the Zoo is a pleasant 10 minute walk away. From there you can easily access all of Berlin's attractions. The hotel rooms were very clean, beds comfortable and breakfast beautifully laid out with a great range of food to choose from. The only slight downside was a bit of traffic noise from the road at the front of the hotel but we are used to no noise at home, so are aware of the slightest noise. All staff were extremely helpful and luggage can be left securely after check out for later collection. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin. Check out the Berlin Welcome card if you are going to be travelling around - it can be purchased at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetsettingSi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a bunch of friends on a stag do. From what I can remember is was a funky stylish hotel, the rooms were clean tidy and modern with a funky bar and restaurant and it was very reasonably priced. Berlin is a great city with a buzzing night life and it is steeped with history.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: f_barou
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great,very clean with comfortable rooms.The staff was extremely helpful when we asked for directions.It was just about 5 min walk to the nearest metro station and the most popular street(kurfusterdam strasse).The price was very good and i would recommend it without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but minor downfalls”
Reviews.Author: travelling_pumpkins
Reviews.Content: Although I do rate this hotel and enjoyed my stay there were a few things that nagged me. Mainly the door lock system. We were repeatedly told at reception to put the key against the lock, twist and push. It doesn't work. They forgot to tell us that in fact you have to pull the door towards you after twisting the lock and then push. What was ever wrong with a normal lock??! Other things that brought this hotel down somewhat was the fact that our cleaner didn't bother replenishing our complimentary teas/coffees in the morning, and initially when we asked for more we were told to go and buy one downstairs in the bar. This was however rectified on day three when we spoke to the reception staff who shortly came up and refilled our supply. Although the cleaner had put the cups and spoons back in their places in the cupboard they hadn't washed them, there were still chocolate on the spoons! The cleaner also didn't bother giving us more shower gel/body lotion on day two, simply filled up the slots with shampoo, the one thing we actually had ourselves. Although the booking on Expedia said the hotel has free wireless access, and there is a sign in the hotel, the wireless simply wouldn't connect and we ended up using the expensive internet PC in reception which wasn't very fast. Finally, the hot water. Despite having the shower down to luke warm there were repeated flashes of scalding hot water coming out of the shower. Not very pleasant and nearly slipped twice from jumping away from the water. However, saying that it's all relative and overall this is a good hotel. It's clean, comfortable, the rooms are big, and although the drinks are overpriced the bar is fairly pleasant. Locationwise it's good too, Kurfurstendamm shopping is a short walk away, so is several U bahn stations taking you everywhere quickly, and Tegel airport is also a bus ride away (get off/on on Kurfurstendamm, the Uhlandstrasse stop). The square just at the back of the hotel has a number of restaurants too. Just one thing about Berlin at Christmas..... everything is closed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Tom25
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location (5 minutes walk from Ulandstrasse Ubahn) close to pubs and restaurants. The staff were very helpful and friendly, they were patient whilst I attempted to speak German, and they even helped with times for Schonefeld Airport express. The hotel bar and breakfast are a little on the expensive side (even with happy hour) We recommend a visit to: Marche on Kurfürstendamm which serves an all you can eat buffet breakfast for 10 euro compared to the hotels 17 euro and Dicke Wirten near Savignplatz (on Carmerstrasse) for hearty cheap german tradiational german food 6 - 10 euro for a main course and 2.90 euro for 500 ml Schneider Weisse (Although you may need to speak your best German here as the staff whilst friendly and helpful dont speak much English) So in summary a lovely hotel, will be back when the weather is warmer!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantstic hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Nogoodusernamesleft
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are just back from a 3 night stay at art'otel berlin city center west and have nothing but good things to say about it. I could waffle on about it for ages so I'll go for the concise option! . Good location, 5 minute walk from U-bahn station and close to a main shopping area. Lovely bakery just around the corner on way to u-bahn. . Room and shared areas all very clean with modern decor. Room serviced every morning. . Room was a good size, furnishings were funky. Bathroom was very clean, fresh and modern with the added extra of some nice toiletries. . Staff pleasant and extremely helpful. . We are big Warhol fans so appreciated the theme and decor. It's tastefully done and definitely not 'Warhol overload'. Loved it and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “definitely coming back”
Reviews.Author: groovejetDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the friendliest staff I've ever encountered on my travels. It's in an excellent location beside ku'damm and on the side street beside the hotel, uhlandstasse, there is many lovely little restaurants. It is so near the u bahn and fairly close to bahnhof zoo. I really liked the theme of the hotel. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have wanted!”
Reviews.Author: Alli_H
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it - definitely the most comfortable room I've ever stayed in! On arrival we were offered a free upgrade, the room was huge, quirky but beautifully furnished and a change from the norm, with the biggest bed I've ever seen. The bathroom was a lovely big wetroom and toiletries were replaced every day. Lots of storage space and the bar's happy hour every day 5-7 was very welcome, particularly as Berlin is now a very expensive city compared with my last trip 3 years ago. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Location-wise it was only a 5 or so minute walk to a couple of stations both on S and U Bahn, and lots of nice restaurants, shops and supermarkets nearby. Felt very safe walking to and from the stations at night. The only slight negative would be the small amount of traffic noise in the morning, although we were only on the first floor so this is probably better on the higher floors, plus a bit of noise is to be expected in a big city. Also after completing an online survey the manager did say there are rooms around the back which are quieter. We wouldn't hesistate in going back, it was most definitely one of the nicest European hotels I have stayed in and was excellent value for money. Something a bit different from the usual type of chain-hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Thunderchief
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip, we didn't realise how close this hotel was to the shopping district and the tourist buses, and it is an easy 10-15 minute walk to Zoo station. The room was very big (probably the biggest room we have ever stayed in Europe), clean and comfortable with a modern TV. The Andy Warhol theme is kind of quirky, which added to the charm of this place. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and quickly (and amusingly) resolved an error with our final bill - we had mistakenly been charged for a packet of nuts from the mini-bar and, when we pointed this out, the attendant asked us to sign a note confirming that "I had no nuts" :-) The hotel is located very close to supermarkets, laundromat, restaurants and a major shopping strip. We don't recommend using the internet in the hotel - there is an internet cafe (which is much cheaper) just a block away near one of the supermarkets. Overall, an extremely pleasant stay and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from the station”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandLee09
Reviews.Content: We find this hotel lovely apart from its location. It's about 25 min walk from the nearest station. But all else were good, the staffs were friendly and helpful. The bed was clean and bathroom was reasonable sized. The design of the hotel was modern.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: stylish_30
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and were thoroughly disappointed. The room, which cost a fortune, was pokey with psychedeilc Andy Warhol art everywhere but not even the basic amenity of coffee making facilities. It was terribly hot on our first night because, as the receptionist admitted the next day, the staffhad forgotten to switch on the airconditioning (although on the night in question, they did not bother to look into it and only asked us to be patient!) Even when they did switch it on on subsequent nights, it was woefully inadequate for a hot summer's day in Berlin. I wish they would concentrate on making it a hotel first and ensure the comfort of its patrons before they attempted to make it an "art museum".

Reviews.Title: “Large sized rooms, excellent staff, wonderful location, clean, good price!”
Reviews.Author: BigAl70
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for three nights costing £133 (as at Feb 2009). I was worried about some of the comments regarding stained carpets, etc. However, dont be worried, this is possibly due to the very light colours used in this hotel that are not wearing well. The hotel room and bathroom were very clean, the beds comfortable, the room warm, etc. The hotel is great, a very good location, with nice, friendly, helpful staff. The K'Dam is about 3 minutes walk. Breakfast was expensive at 15 euro per person - I would recommned going to one of the many cafes/ resteraunts for breakfast that are near to this hotel. Our room had a mini-bar - which was, like all mini bars, expensive. we emptied out mini bar, got stuff like drinks and chocolate from the nearby Kaiser store then returned the mini-bar stuff back in the fridge, which saved us a fortune! Near the hotel are loads of excellend places to eat and drink - the nearby wine bar and sushi places are excellent, as are the traditional German places to eat. Another plus point about this hotel is that it is very near the U1 train line, which takes you to the centre of Berlin very easily- a good tip is to get travel passes from tourist information - 24 euro for 3 72 hours unlimited travel is a bargain. The next time me and the misses go to Berlin, we will stay at this hotel as it was really nice, safe, friendly, clean, in a great location and cheap! And the Andy Wharhol are theme is well cool! Slanj, Al and Nat.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottyd783
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Slightly out of centre at the end of the U1 U-bahn line. Very nice and fashionable hotel at a very reasonable price. Surrounding area bit run down but maybe only a 5 min walk from the fashionable Kurfendamm shopping area

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value, friendly staff, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Bullen
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel via priceline for a ridiculously low price. We stayed for four nights and would without doubt stay here again. Very serviceminded and friendly staff. The room was exceptionally clean with a big and beautiful bathroom. The lobby has free wi-fi, the breakfast was very good with a wide range to chose from, and the hours for serving breakfast was generous. This is situated in the heart of the center of west Berlin and it is easy to find nice shops, restaurants and cafées in an easy walking distance. Since the U-bahn and S-bahn is near and easy and comfortable to use it's easy to get to other parts of the town.

Reviews.Title: “A Berlin Gem”
Reviews.Author: Beau121
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin (7-10 November 2008) for my daughter and myself. My daughter booked the weekend in Berlin for my birthday. She chose this hotel from a search on the web of the variety of hotels available in Berlin, then booked a flight with Ryanair and we made our way to the hotel via the rail link from Schonefeld Airport to Savignyplatz Station, a short walk from the hotel. We had read the reviews about this hotel on the web, which in certain cases gave some back feedback, unfounded in our case. I can honestly say we were apprehensive on arrival but on walking through the door, we were greeted by very friendly staff, who were professional in there approach to us and certainly went out of there way to make our three day stay a joy to behold. We booked breakfast for each morning (buffet style) the variety of food on offer was excellent and plentiful, (they had a special offer on at 8 euros each). We asked for a quite room and received one on the top floor (6th) to the back of the building facing a court yard. On walking in we were delighted with the colour scheme and the Andy Warhol theme, which is present through out the hotel (no we are not Andy Warhol fans). We found the whole of the hotels decor to be very pleasing on the eye. Cleanliness and comfort was first class along with TV and the usual mod cons. No tea/coffee maker in the room, which wasn't a problem This hotel is not central in Berlin but we walked right across Berlin, from the hotel in the west to the East Side Gallery (Berlin Wall). I work as a freelance in the Tourism and Travel sector as a Photojournalist so this was a great opportunity to capture many images of life around Berlin. Very pleased indeed with the hotel, staff, breakfasts and its position in Berlin. Would recommend it to any one visiting Berlin who needs to be in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly good”
Reviews.Author: Donbacio
Reviews.Content: After miraculously getting a very good rate (for one night only, though), I had been cautious about a number of things - some of the reviews said "brace yourself for stained carpets" and stuff; and you know how good rates sometimes mean a catch here and a catch there. Well, not in this case - the hotel really blew me away! It was so incredibly clean it (almost) hurt! Some people may complain about the size of rooms, but then they probably book a hotel room to host a ballroom dance party. As far as my stay was concerned, I could find no fault at all - the bathroom was superb, the air-conditioning worked perfectly, windows offered excellent sound protection from the street traffic... and no, the Andy Warhol theme did not put me off one bit - it's really quite subtle and inobtrusive. Yes, they'd gladly serve you breakfast and then charge for it through the nose, but nobody makes you have it if you don't want to. All in all, a perfect hotel with some nice touches (such as posting weather forecast in an elevator) - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin in early May. Picked the Art'otel because had stayed at other properties and liked them. The property is unique due to the Warhol theme. Get prepared for some bright purples and greens. It's all in fun though. I would stay here again due to the surrounding neighborhoods As usual, the good, bad and ugly. The Good - Room was clean and fairly-well kept (a new paint job could be used). The room had essentials and was fine. Nothing too amazing - everything fairly standard. Room had good size closet along with a sizeable enough room. It had bed only and no room for separate sitting area. - Bathroom - sizeable and clean. Had decent shower. - Location for the price. The location is about a 10ish minute walk to city-center (West Berlin). The subway could be had in about half that time. - Neighborhoods surrounding the hotel. We ate each night in the neighborhood at great restaurants with good value. Do yourself a favor, and branch out around the hotel and find some of these jewels. - Front desk arranged van service to airport for 15 Euros. Pick up was on time and the ride was quite pleasant. The Bad - 16ish Euros each for breakfast. Too high priced in my eyes. While there was a decent selection of OK food, close cafes made it a no-brainer for following mornings. - Check-in. While the hostess did a nice quick job, she assigned a smoking room after asking for a non-smoking. When I went down to inform her, she was waiting for me. My thought is she could have met me on the floor, admitted the mistake and gave me new room keys versus waiting for me. There were multiple people behind the desk so leaving the front area should have been fine. - If you are planning on spending most of your time in "East" Berlin, this may not be the best place. While the public transportation system was excellent, it took us 40ish minutes to get from hotel to Alexanderplatz including one metro line change (bus system was on strike). - The towels. The smell of the clean towels was absolutely horrid. The typical vinegar-like smell is horrid. I do not understand why hotels do not spend a bit more to ensure fresh smelling towels or have no smell at all. The Art'otel is not the only hotel with this issue. The Ugly - Nothing. I would recommend this place as long as one is mobile and does not mind walking a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Arty hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Holly290
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 2 nights in Januay. Berlin was very nice. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is quite modern and very colourful. Staff were very friendly. The rooms were the tiniest we have ever seen. They were more than adequate though. Extremely clean and comfortable with the exception of the size. Bearing in mind the good price we paid for the room however the size did not really bother us. The location is excellent. Within a short walking distance of most things. The Hard Rock cafe is just around the corner and we found a nice little bar nearby with an amazing happy hour every night. The beers are huge!!! Would recommend this hotel and would stay in it again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at art'otel”
Reviews.Author: skins89
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with partner & could find no fault at all,staff friendly & helpful,good breakfast to set you up for the day,clean & well situated for the underground station Would def stay here again if back in berlin,good experience all round.

Reviews.Title: “not so arty”
Reviews.Author: KetKet
Reviews.Content: I read a few bad reviews before my stay in this hotel and now i can only confirm it. the personell is a bit rude, stains on the carpet show the lack of cleanliness, except the sleeping and showering there is not much else to do in this hotel - pay tv tops it all-obviously everything here is extra and very expensive. the location is great, cause it's really near ku'damm and a few excellent restaurants but other that that there is nothing else good about this hotel if you're used to real four (or three) stars - regarding german standards. i'm sure you can find a better 3/4* hotel in the same area for same price.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSusan
Reviews.Content: Have just come back and was very disappointed. We got a room in the 1st floor and it was very noisy. The room was pretty small, very basic, the carpet was stained, the walls had many marks of what I guess are suitcases marks, and the shower floor had permanent dirt that didn't seem to come off. I would say that the only advantage of this hotel is it's central location. Would not suggest to stay there if you can afford some thing better! Looking back I would have preffered to pay more and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Fongerini
