Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable 5nt stay in 2 rooms for my family of 5. Rooms were comfy, decent sized, with the larger rooms able to hold an additional rollaway bed if desired. Coffee & tea making equipment was provided, as well as a minifridge stocked with beverages. Bathrooms were clean, good-sized, with combo bath/showers. Location was pretty good. 1 block S of Ku'damm with all its shopping and restaurants. 2 blocks to the Uhlandstrasse U-bahn. Bus stop 1 short block away that takes you to Zoo station where you can connect to any other type of transportation. Since breakfast was an additional 11-15 Euros pp, we opted to buy pastries daily from a couple of bakeries nearby for breakfast. There were also 2 grocery stores within 2 blocks. Clusters of nearby restaurants 1 blk away on Uhlandstrasse, 2 blks N on Ku'damm, and 2 blks S around Ludwigkircheplatz. The staff was nice & pretty helpful. The door lock mechanisms were difficult to figure out at first. Wifi availability was convenient but a little expensive, as was computer use in the lobby. Online rates were excellent at 59-79 Euros/nt with no xtra chg for a rollaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Zwenn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights here recently. The room was reasonably clean, reasonably sized. Staff was very friendly. We had trouble figuring out exactly how the air conditioning worked. Whether you like the omnipresent Warhol theme and the colouring scheme (lots of lime green and yellow) is a question of taste I guess. What we DEFINITELY liked was the location. The hotel is just off the main shopping mile of Ku’damm, halfway between the big department stores around the Kaiser Wilhelm church and the more upmarket shops at the lower end of Ku’damm.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with great style”
Reviews.Author: kathrynjc
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister went to this hotel last September for three nights- Friday, Sat & Sun. We got a bit lost coming out of the zoo train station so the work was longer than if we had known the way. The hotel is actually just a minute away from Ku'damm and there's three easily accessible underground stations nearby. Check in wasn' until 3pm but when we arrived at 11.30am our room was ready and the reception staff were really helpful. The young man gave us a map and marked where the hotel was and where local underground stations and good restaurants where. The room was spacious, very clean & fabuously decorated- we had some drunken fun on the chair that spun round! the beds were big and comfy, bathroom was huge & air conditioning was easy to use & effective. Didn't use hotel restaurant but did use the bar and found the staff were friendly and the drinks very strong! Overall we loved this hotel- it was very cool and relaxed, in a great location for shopping and getting around generally and had lots of beer gardens nearby. Hard Rock cafe is also a five min walk away if you fancy a retro evening. I loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it, especially as the prices are so reasonable - £210 for two people for three nights. Uber bargain.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shinypearlgirl
Reviews.Content: On a leisure trip, we stayed at this hotel because the friends we were traveling with had already pre-booked there, so there was pretty much no choice. However, I have to say that this was a good experience! An artsy hotel (as the name implies), pop-artsy to be exact, with Andy Warhol holding court on walls, decorations and colour schemes -- a very bright and pleasant environment! Very young and extremely friendly staff, OK bar and food, expensive but good breakfast (wasn't included), great rooms in lime green colour schemes, spotlessly clean, central (very near the famous Kudamm)... the list goes on and on. The only drawback seemed to be the very strange room door opening system. All in all, a very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel,but not too clean”
Reviews.Author: Ftraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice modern Andy Warhol Hotel. The Room was very big but there were spots over the bed. The staff was very jung but friendly and the location good.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: Got this room via Priceline at a great rate. Hotel is somewhat in an isolated area of Berlin but the walk to the KuDamm is really close. The decor and modern feel of the room is not my taste. Beds were ok, but the design of the shower is interesting. The water easily escapes the shower area and onto the main bathroom floor and even outside the door, which was disappointing. Even though there is a restaurant and bar on the premises, I felt this hotel is more like a 3 star, but you cant beat the price. Staff is nice, however. Parents beware that the pay tv shows XXX rated previews of the movies!!! I would not book my next stay to Berlin at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: raskolnikov
Reviews.Content: The best breakfast known to man (well, 2nd best: the best is available at the E&O Hotel, Penang). There was simply everything and anything available including smoked salmon and champagne! Buffet style too. Cheesetastic. Berlin's quite a noisy city and despite being doubly double-glazed there was still some road noise. Room had minibar which was curiously and obtrusively filled by staff shortly after our arrival, ie without knocking. Decor Ikea like. Good bathroom. Plenty of frills. Styling unusal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; great value”
Reviews.Author: Texas-One
Reviews.Content: We were in Southern Germany for the World Cup and decided to take a trip north to Berlin with our three kids. We picked this hotel based on the feedback from Tripadvisor and were very impressed. Room were an excellent value for the money, were extrememly clean and quiet, and had excellent access to the shopping, eating, transportation and sightseeing. The breakfast was very reasonable and quite good. I had stayed in Berlin for three nights ealier in the trip at a different hotel and paid three times as much for 1/2 the ambiance and experience. I would absolutely stay here again. The only downsides were limited on-site parking and (like most German hotels) limited ability to sleep two adults and three kids in one room.

Reviews.Title: “nice 3+ star (nearly 4 star) hotel”
Reviews.Author: alpha333
Reviews.Content: good modern hotel, better than 3star but not quite 4star... good for tourists, or even business travelers. small but clean rooms. good hotel, but nothing special... great location of course

Reviews.Title: “Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: wenluvstravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located near the Ku'damn. There's a taxi stand located across the street from the hotel and a Metro stop is one block away. There are many nice restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. We received an excellent rate on the website. I would definitely recommend this hotel for it's value and cleanliness. However, I would have preferred to stay in Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: barorna
Reviews.Content: Stay there for five nights. The hotel is located on a main noisy road but in a nice and elegant neighbourhood. There are lot of cosy and smart restaurants and cafe in the vicinity - lots of dining options. The staff are very nice and helpful. The room is very basic, large enough and clean, but a bit "cold" and not so intimate. We check one hour before offical check-in time and they charged us for an extra 5 euro for it!!! - we checked out 4 hours before time and didn't get credit for that.... As previous reviewer has noticed, the airconditioner didn't work and the room was too hot at night. We asked the reception to solve the problem but they didn't take care of it! If you want to stay on the west side of the city and not to spend lots of money - it's a good choice. If you expect to stay in a place more characteristic - stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely for the money”
Reviews.Author: Dilp
Reviews.Content: For 38GBP on Priceline this hotel was excellent value for our four night stay if you're wanting to stay in the West End. Like a previous reviewer, I also received a lovely fruit platter on my birthday - a really nice touch. No problems with the room other than it was a bit hot at night (maybe the aircon wasn't working?). The bathrooms are large with walk-in shower. All the young staff were extremely polite and helpful. Didn't try the restaurant, but the bar area is quite cool. Location is 2 minute walk from the Ku'dam, and about 5 or 10 minutes from the S-Bahn station at Savignyplatz (try the always busy Italian restaurant XII Apostolis next to the station for excellent food and lively atmosphere).

Reviews.Title: “Nice & stylish”
Reviews.Author: sopeeck
Reviews.Content: Staying one night in Berlin for attending a conference we - or rather my boss ;) - decided to go for the Art'otel. Fair price, nice stylish Andy Warhol Design elements, nice people working there and and a good night of sleeped located close to the Ku'damm. I surely will consider it as an alternative when returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: b98006
Reviews.Content: Nothing too exciting about this hotel, but nothing bad as well. Location is fairly good for tourists - Nearest metro and the main shopping high street is just 5 mins walk away. To get to most of the attractions though you have to go to Mitte area but for a good price (under E100), this is a nice place. (We really enjoyed walking on the main street and actually would prefer to stay here than Mitte - the cafe scene is really nice). Negatives - We got to hotel at 11am but they would not let us check in before 2pm. We had requested a crib for our baby but we got a rollaway bed. Our room was on the main street so we did hear a bit of traffic noise but it didnt really affect our sleep. We didnt have the breakfast as it seemed too expensive and there are so many cafes nearby that one can go to that it didnt seem worth it. Overall the hotel staff was very accomodating and helpful and I would recommend this hotel to people who want to stay in a good standard hotel at a budgeted price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay here.”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: I had a very positive experience at this hotel. I stayed for 6 nights in May. Room was perfectly adequate and comfortable. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful. My first room on the 6th floor was huge ( or maybe because i had just been staying in Amsterdam! ) and my second room smaller but again fine. I would definately stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: julia687
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about the hotel, the service on recption was great they couldn't be more helpful, they have thought of everything including lending you a brolly if it's raining. Think we got upgraded as the room was very big, it had a seating area with comfy chairs and a table and had a kettle with lots of tea's and coffee which the website says you don't get. There was a minibar too which had enough space for you to put your own drinks in it. The green carpet wasn't as bad as it looks on the photos think you get used it! Everything was very clean and comfortable, we even got left little chocolates on the pillow at night, a nice touch though it may be because it was Easter. We didn't eat in the hotel, however about a 5 - 10 min walk brings you to Ku-damm with lots of restaurants, there is also the entrance to Ku-damm Karree (a shopping center) opposite the hotel which as shops,the story of berin incluing a nucular bunker and a few drinking places in it. On arrival at Zoo station we got a taxi to the hotel which was only 5 euros, it takes about 15 mins to walk and is very easy to find. The nearest U bahn station is Kurfustendamm and is about a 5-10 min walk from the hotel. I would definaly stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: manchester_freak
Reviews.Content: We loved the Art'otel. The lobby area, with a sofa and computer on one side, the desk, and then a bar/lounge on the other is totally comfortable and has great art on the walls. The rooms are clean and spacious, a great place to relax after a long day or late night! The only thing that would make it perfect is if they had wireless Internet. It's only a 5-minute walk from the Uhlandstrasse U-bahn, and not much farther to other stops on other lines. Excellent location. I'd definitely like to stay there again. Can't wait to go back to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: londonboots
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer, we got a great deal through Expedia which made our 2-night stay here excellent value for money. The room was comfortable and clean, the bathroom was big and even though our room was on the road, it was not noisy at all. The staff were friendly and efficient. Unlike some other reviewers, we really loved the Warhol theme and bright colours. The location was great - very close to Ku'damm and an easy walk to Zoo Station.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, but not tres chic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay there, the rooms were clean, quiet, well kept. The only downside was the overpriced and lackluster breakfast. Having stayed in many German hotels, the usual breakfast fare was much better at other places. In fact, most of them were punishing in their many choices! If you stay there, plan on tourist activities in central Berlin and outlying areas via Bahn/U-Bahn. Don't expect anything extra. It's a bare bones place with fun, modern design. Considering exchange rates, its not a bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot”
Reviews.Author: ChuckProphet
Reviews.Content: Dunno where some of these reviewers are at. This place was excellent. 1. Location - 2 minutes from the KuDamm 2. Room - for €99 a night for 2 this was excellent value. Rooms were spotless, decent size. 3. Breakfast - Best breakfast I ever had in a hotel. Lots of choice..they had about 10 types of cheese alone! 4. Staff - very friendly and helpful. All in all a great place to explore Berlin from.

Reviews.Title: “Too much Warhol”
Reviews.Author: Jaded
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a three day stay, and liked this hotel. We were a group of 6 women. The restaurant area is quite stylish, though empty apart from at breakfast time. We had one breakfast there which was good, but expensive. Better to go somewhere else to eat. Recommend the Twelve Apostles for breakfast which is an Italian restaurant about 10 minutes walk away. Reception were friendly and helpful, and in fact it was them that recommended the Italian restaurant. The rooms are very clean, well-equipped and generally comfortable. It was very hot at night, and there the air conditioning didn’t seem to work. The standard is a double rather than a twin bed, and even though we had specified twins we got doubles. After the first night, they were able to find rooms with twin beds. Location is good for shopping and eating out, but the main sites are not walking distance away. However we found taxis cheaper than in the UK. This is a Warhol themed hotel, with many prints and photos. I liked the prints but could have done with less photos ;-)

Reviews.Title: “It's fine, but is basic and not customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: LinnyUKNZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel position is alright and reasonably close to a train station - which you will need to use to get around to see the main sights, which are mainly centre East. Upon arrival our room was not ready and we were offered a larger room for an extra €10 per night. For the sake of convenience we said yes - guess they bank on that. The room was fine, clean, but very basic. There wasn't even tea / coffee making facilities, something I expect as standard and have always had, even from lower star rated hotels. I enquired at the hotel desk about this and found that it was available, at an extra cost of €8 per day. I guess they want to encourage guests to use the hotel's bar / restaurant facilities. Whilst staying there I wasn't aware that any of their recreational facilities were on site - I think they had nothing and that everything must have been in the vicinity of the hotel. When we checked out there were 4 other sets of guests at the desk and all had problems. One lot had been 'upgraded' but hadn't been informed that it would cost them more money - luckily we were told of the extra cost. One lot had a baby and were put in a room which had no bath and so they couldn't bath the baby = they wanted to move rooms which seemed to be a problem... I think that showers were standard, rather than baths. The others were also querying their bills as they were checking out. Basically this hotel is fine, but I think you could probably pay the same money for somewhere better or for a better location. Somewhere that is managed better and is more customer aware and friendly, that isn't constantly trying to make more money out of you - I know that all hotels are trying to do this, but not all are so blatant about it.

Reviews.Title: “Location was not the top”
Reviews.Author: manhattan74
Reviews.Content: First of all, beware of the gym : THERE's NO GYM, in despite of what they say in their brochures. The breakfast is not worthy at all... several kinds of yogourth, bacon, and orange juicy...that ' s it, overpriced for 15 Eur. The TV is plenty of german channels, but you will just reach one foreign channel : CNN, that 's all,... The staff is correct, but dont expect too much from them... ordered a wake up call and they forget it, placed a dont disturb signal in the door, and housekeeping was entering in the room every half hour the same.... There's a internet point in the lobby, but 5 Euros/hour doesnt seem to be any good deal...(no fraction time) The location is not superb,.. the main touristic spots are far far far away from there... if i ever visit the city of berlin, i ll be for sure in Mitte, which is the area to stay for the first time when on tourism in Berlin. Got a rate of 68 Eur nite (excl breakfast) and at that price is okay... Beware of the safety in the rooms,... when housekeeping is around, she let more than one room door opened at the same time meanwhile she's cleaning, but she s alone,..so someone could take our your properties just by entering in a second....doesnt appear to be safe at all the way they clean....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and well priced through Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art'otel Dec 17-19, 2004. We enjoyed the ambience of the hotel and the service received. There were absolutely no complaints!
